New Records: Ben Stokes scored an unbeaten 52 from 49 balls, propelling England to a target of 138 with an over to spare.
Key Match Events: Ben Stokes clinched his first international T20 half-century with the four that levelled the scores, before hauling the single through the leg-side that took England to the title.
Adil Rashid, Sam Curran, and Chris Jordan excelled with the ball, with Rashid removing key players like Babar Azam and Mohammad Rizwan.
Pre-Game Insights: England were reduced to 45-3 inside the powerplay and faced a challenging target of 138 after early losses of key players.
The match was anticipated as Pakistan aimed to repeat their 1992 victory over England.
Post-Match Reflections: England secured their second T20 World Cup title and celebrated their dual white-ball success.
The victory marked a pivotal moment in their playoff push and highlighted their resilience after a tough start to the tournament.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held at the Melbourne Cricket Ground, and the article mentions future fixtures against Australia and Pakistan.
